summary: TypeScript SDK hostname validation is overly restrictive and prevents connecting to Temporal instances hosted behind reverse proxies at subpaths. The validation only allows hostname or hostname:port format, rejecting paths like /temporal.
userImpact: Users cannot connect to Temporal instances hosted behind reverse proxies at subpaths, blocking legitimate deployment scenarios that work with the Go SDK and Temporal UI.
rootCause: SDK hostname normalization logic restricts input to hostname or hostname:port format and rejects URLs with path components.
keyQuote: Temporal and Temporal UI allows this just fine and it works as expected, but the typescript SDK attempts to normalize it and only allows hostname or hostname:port
